description: This legacy package (libraries) is intended for projects imported from mikroC PRO for dsPIC into Necto studio, or suppose you want to quickly test your code in Necto Studio with libraries available in mikroC PRO for dsPIC. The package contains all libraries from mikroC PRO for dsPIC version v7.1.0, with improvements needed to work with Necto Studio.

boards.description: EasyPIC v8 for dsPIC30 is our eighth generation dsPIC development board. It is loaded with modules you will need in development of your DSP applications. On-board programmer and debugger, CAN support, display connectors and six I/O groups are just part of the modules on this board. It is delivered with dsPIC30F4013 device.

EasyPIC v8 for dsPIC24/dsPIC33 is one of our eighth generation dsPIC development board. It is loaded with modules you will need in development of your DSP applications. On-board programmer and debugger, CAN support, display connectors and three I/O groups are just part of the modules on this board. It is delivered with dsPIC2416KA102 device.

EasyPIC Fusion v7 combines support for three different architectures: dsPIC33, PIC24 and PIC32 in a single development board It contains many on-board modules, including multimedia, Ethernet, USB, CAN and other. On-board mikroProg programmer and debugger supports 101 microcontrollers via MCU cards.

EasyPIC v7 for dsPIC30 is our seventh generation dsPIC development board. It is loaded with modules you will need in development of your DSP applications. On-board programmer and debugger, CAN support, temperature sensors, display connectors and six I/O groups are just part of the modules on this board. It is delivered with dsPIC30F4013 device.

Easy24-33 v6 development system supports 14-, 18-, 20- and 28-pin PIC24 and dsPIC33 microcontrollers from Microchip. It comes with a PIC24F16KA102. The system features a USB 2.0 programmer with mikroICD and many peripheral modules such as Touch Sense, Serial RAM, EEPROM, etc.

Clicker 2 for PIC24 is a compact development kit with two mikroBUS sockets for click board connectivity. It carries the PIC24FJ1024GB610, a 16-bit microcontroller, two indication LEDs, two general purpose buttons, a reset button, an ON/OFF switch, a li-polymer battery connector, a micro USB connector and two mikroBUS sockets.

Clicker 2 for dsPIC33 is a compact development kit with two mikroBUS sockets for click board connectivity. It carries the dsPIC33EP512MU810, a 16-bit microcontroller, two indication LEDs, two general purpose buttons, a reset button, an ON/OFF switch, a li-polymer battery connector, a micro USB connector and two mikroBUS sockets.
This is a generic board definition. It can be combined with any of supported MCUs.
